item.title: CrushFTP warns users to patch unauthenticated access flaw immediately
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: CrushFTP warned customers of an unauthenticated HTTP(S) port access vulnerability and urged them to patch their servers immediately. [...]

item.title: Cloudflare R2 service outage caused by password rotation error
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Cloudflare has announced that its R2 object storage and dependent services experienced an outage lasting 1 hour and 7 minutes, causing 100% write and 35% read failures globally. [...]

item.title: Broadcom warns of authentication bypass in VMware Windows Tools
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Broadcom released security updates today to fix a high-severity authentication bypass vulnerability in VMware Tools for Windows. [...]

item.title: New Windows zero-day leaks NTLM hashes, gets unofficial patch
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Free unofficial patches are available for a new Windows zero-day vulnerability that can let remote attackers steal NTLM credentials by tricking targets into viewing malicious files in Windows Explorer. [...]

item.title: EncryptHub linked to MMC zero-day attacks on Windows systems
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A threat actor known as EncryptHub has been linked to Windows zero-day attacks exploiting a Microsoft Management Console vulnerability patched this month. [...]

item.title: Browser-in-the-Browser attacks target CS2 players' Steam accounts
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new phishing campaign targets Counter-Strike 2 players utilizing Browser-in-the-Browser (BitB) attacks that display a realistic window that mimics Steam's login page. [...]

item.title: New Android malware uses Microsoft’s .NET MAUI to evade detection
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: New Android malware campaigns use Microsoft's cross-platform framework .NET MAUI while disguising as legitimate services to evade detection. [...]

item.title: 23andMe files for bankruptcy, customers advised to delete DNA data
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​California-based genetic testing provider 23andMe has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy and plans to sell its assets following years of financial struggles. [...]

item.title: New VanHelsing ransomware targets Windows, ARM, ESXi systems
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new multi-platform ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operation named VanHelsing has emerged, targeting Windows, Linux, BSD, ARM, and ESXi systems. [...]

item.title: Cyberattack takes down Ukrainian state railway’s online services
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Ukrzaliznytsia, Ukraine's national railway operator, has been hit by a massive cyberattack that disrupted online services for buying tickets both through mobile apps and the website. [...]

item.title: DrayTek routers worldwide go into reboot loops over weekend
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Many Internet service providers (ISPs) worldwide are alerting customers of an outage that started Saturday night and triggered DrayTek router connectivity problems. [...]

item.title: Chinese Weaver Ant hackers spied on telco network for 4 years
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A China-linked advanced threat group named Weaver Ant spent more than four years in the network of a telecommunications services provider, hiding traffic and infrastructure with the help of compromised Zyxel CPE routers. [...]
